Package camzup.pfriendly

Interface IUp3

All Superinterfaces:
IUp
All Known Implementing Classes:
Up3, Yup3, Zup3
public interface IUp3
extends IUp
Maintains consistent behavior across 3D renderers that extend different branches of PGraphics.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Handedness DEFAULT_HANDEDNESS
    The default renderer handedness.
    static float GRID_FAC
    Factor by which a grid's count is scaled when dimensions are not supplied.
    static float POLARITY_TOLERANCE
    Tolerance beneath which the camera's forward direction will be considered the world, or reference, up direction.

    Fields inherited from interface camzup.pfriendly.IUp

    COLOR_MODE_MAX, COLOR_MODE_MIN, DEFAULT_ASPECT, DEFAULT_BKG_COLOR, DEFAULT_CAM_DIST_FAC, DEFAULT_COLOR_MAX, DEFAULT_FAR_CLIP, DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR, DEFAULT_FOV, DEFAULT_HALF_HEIGHT, DEFAULT_HALF_WIDTH, DEFAULT_HANDLE_COLOR, DEFAULT_HANDLE_COORD_COLOR, DEFAULT_HANDLE_FORE_COLOR, DEFAULT_HANDLE_REAR_COLOR, DEFAULT_I_COLOR, DEFAULT_IJK_LINE_FAC, DEFAULT_IJK_SWEIGHT, DEFAULT_J_COLOR, DEFAULT_K_COLOR, DEFAULT_LOC_X, DEFAULT_LOC_Y, DEFAULT_LOC_Z, DEFAULT_NEAR_CLIP, DEFAULT_ORDER, DEFAULT_STROKE_COLOR, DEFAULT_STROKE_WEIGHT, DEFAULT_TEXT_LEADING, DEFAULT_TEXT_SIZE, HANDLE_COORD_WEIGHT, HANDLE_FORE_WEIGHT, HANDLE_REAR_WEIGHT, MIXER_HSVA, MIXER_RGBA

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void bezier​(Vec3 ap0, Vec3 cp0, Vec3 cp1, Vec3 ap1)

    Draws a cubic Bezier curve segment to the next anchor point; the first and second control point shape the curve segment.

  • Method Details

    • bezier

      void bezier​(Vec3 ap0, Vec3 cp0, Vec3 cp1, Vec3 ap1)
      Draws a cubic Bezier curve between two anchor points, where the control points shape the curve.
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point

    • bezierVertex

      void bezierVertex​(Vec3 cp0, Vec3 cp1, Vec3 ap1)
      Draws a cubic Bezier curve segment to the next anchor point; the first and second control point shape the curve segment.
      Parameters:
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the next anchor point

    • camera

      void camera​(float xEye, float yEye, float zEye, float xCenter, float yCenter, float zCenter)
      Looks at the center point from the eye point, using a default reference up axis.
      Parameters:
      xEye - camera location x
      yEye - camera location y
      zEye - camera location z
      xCenter - target location x
      yCenter - target location y
      zCenter - target location z

    • camera

      default void camera​(Vec3 eye, Vec3 center)
      Sets the camera to a location, looking at a center, with the default up direction.
      Parameters:
      eye - the eye location
      center - the center of the gaze

    • dolly

      void dolly​(float z)
      Dollies the camera, moving it on its local z axis, backward or forward. This is done by multiplying the z magnitude by the camera inverse, then adding the local coordinates to the camera location and look target.
      Parameters:
      z - the z magnitude

      Returns:

      default Vec3 mouse1s​(Vec3 target)

      Returns:
      the mouse

    • mouse1u

      default Vec3 mouse1u​(Vec3 target)
      Gets a mouse within the range [0.0, 1.0] . The mouse's y coordinate is flipped.
      Parameters:
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse

    • moveTo

      default void moveTo​(float x, float y, float z)
      Moves the renderer's camera to the given location, then updates the camera.
      Parameters:
      x - the location x
      y - the location y
      z - the location z

    • moveTo

      default void moveTo​(Vec3 locNew)
      Moves the renderer's camera to the given location, then updates the camera.
      Parameters:
      locNew - the new location
      See Also:
      moveTo(float, float, float)

    • moveTo

      default void moveTo​(Vec3 locNew, float step)
      Moves the renderer's camera to a given location and updates the camera. Uses clamped linear interpolation, so the step should be smoothed prior to calling this function.
      Parameters:
      locNew - the new location
      step - the step
      See Also:
      getLocX(), getLocY(), getLocZ(), moveTo(float, float, float)

    • normal

      void normal​(float x, float y, float z)
      Assigns a normal to a vertex.
      Parameters:
      x - the x component
      y - the y component
      z - the z component

    • normal

      default void normal​(Vec3 n)
      Assigns a normal to a vertex.
      Parameters:
      n - the normal

    • pedestal

      void pedestal​(float y)
      Boom or pedestal the camera, moving it on its local y axis, up or down. This is done by multiplying the y magnitude by the camera inverse, then adding the local coordinates to both the camera location and look target.
      Parameters:
      y - the y magnitude

    • point

      void point​(float x, float y, float z)
      Draws a 3D point.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      z - the z coordinate

    • point

      default void point​(Vec3 v)
      Draws a point at a given coordinate
      Parameters:
      v - the coordinate

    • quadraticVertex

      void quadraticVertex​(Vec3 cp, Vec3 ap1)
      Draws a quadratic Bezier curve segment to the next anchor point; the control point shapes the curve segment.
      Parameters:
      cp - the control point
      ap1 - the next anchor point

    • ray

      default void ray​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float zOrigin, float xDir, float yDir, float zDir, float dLen)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x origin
      yOrigin - the y origin
      zOrigin - the z origin
      xDir - the x direction
      yDir - the y direction
      zDir - the z direction
      dLen - the display length

    • ray

      default void ray​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float zOrigin, float xDir, float yDir, float zDir, float dLen, float lnwgt, float oWeight, float dWeight)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x origin
      yOrigin - the y origin
      zOrigin - the z origin
      xDir - the x direction
      yDir - the y direction
      zDir - the z direction
      dLen - the display length
      lnwgt - the line weight
      oWeight - the origin stroke weight
      dWeight - the direction stroke weight

    • ray

      default void ray​(Ray3 ray, float dLen)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray
      dLen - the display length

    • ray

      default void ray​(Ray3 ray, float dLen, float lnwgt, float oWeight, float dWeight)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray
      dLen - the display length
      lnwgt - the line weight
      oWeight - the origin stroke weight
      dWeight - the direction stroke weight

    • truck

      void truck​(float x)
      Trucks the camera, moving it on its local x axis, left or right. This is done by multiplying the x magnitude by the camera inverse, then adding the local coordinates to both the camera location and look target.
      Parameters:
      x - the x magnitude

    • vertex

      void vertex​(Vec3 v)
      Adds another vertex to a shape between the beginShape and endShape commands.
      Parameters:
      v - the coordinate

    • mouse1s

      static Vec3 mouse1s​(processing.core.PApplet parent, Vec3 target)
      Gets a mouse within a unit square, where either component may be in the range [-1.0, 1.0] . The mouse's y coordinate is flipped and assigned to the vector's y component. (This is not a normalized vector.)
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent applet
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse

    • mouse1u

      static Vec3 mouse1u​(processing.core.PApplet parent, Vec3 target)
      Gets a mouse within the range [0.0, 1.0]. The mouse's y coordinate is flipped.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent applet
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse
